channel.title: The Universe
channel.description:
Do [b]you[/b] think man-kind will [i]ever[/i] explore other galaxies? and [i]what do [b]you[/b] think[/i] they will find?
Discuss.
[img]http://whyfiles.org/223orbital_astro/images/deep_field_big.jpg[/img]

item.title: The Universe
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:27, topic:202258”][quote author=yakman link=topic=266973.msg2221324#msg2221324 date=1210546354]
Einstein says no

according to Einsteins work, as your speed increases, your mass increases too,
when something is traveling at the speed of light, its mass is so huge that it needs a very large amount of energy to move it, more energy then exists in the universe.
only mass-less things, like EMP radiation can travel at the speed of light
[/quote]

Einstein says it’s impossible for matter to move through space faster than the speed of light.
He says nothing (IIRC) about moving space itself faster than the speed of light, for example by combining the directed force of several bodies that have strong frame dragging effects.

Furthermore, he also states the mass and energy are essentially equivalent, so nothing prevents us from transforming our mass into massless energy, and then transporting at the speed of light (Except technical limitations which might be overcome in the next thousand years)[/quote]

In the next thousand years, we will all be dead from global warming ;).

But really, this is all theory. We have never proven anything. We will never know the full truth until we actually have the technology to do it. I think we do have the technology, but like most people do, they wont release it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Universe
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:23, topic:202258”]Einstein says no

according to Einsteins work, as your speed increases, your mass increases too,
when something is traveling at the speed of light, its mass is so huge that it needs a very large amount of energy to move it, more energy then exists in the universe.
only mass-less things, like EMP radiation can travel at the speed of light[/quote]

Einstein says it’s impossible for matter to move through space faster than the speed of light.
He says nothing (IIRC) about moving space itself faster than the speed of light, for example by combining the directed force of several bodies that have strong frame dragging effects.

Furthermore, he also states the mass and energy are essentially equivalent, so nothing prevents us from transforming our mass into massless energy, and then transporting at the speed of light (Except technical limitations which might be overcome in the next thousand years)

Read full topic
